001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Mediator;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils.Pair;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss.BatchLossFunction;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss.DimensionLossFunction;
008import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss.SampleLossFunction;
009
010import java.util.ArrayList;
011import java.util.List;
012
013/**
014 * The implementation of the {@link ObjectiveFunction}.
015 *
016 * <p>
017 * {@code ObjectiveFunctionImpl} composes together different levels of
018 * loss functions — dimension, sample, and batch — to provide a complete
019 * objective function suitable for training and optimization.
020 * </p>
021 *
022 * <p>
023 * The implementation delegates responsibility as follows:
024 * <ul>
025 *   <li>Uses a {@link DimensionLossFunction} to compute per-dimension error
026 *       and gradients.</li>
027 *   <li>Uses a {@link SampleLossFunction} to aggregate dimension-level losses
028 *       into a single sample loss.</li>
029 *   <li>Uses a {@link BatchLossFunction} to aggregate sample losses into a
030 *       batch loss.</li>
031 * </ul>
032 * </p>
033 */
034@Mediator
035@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
036public class ObjectiveFunctionImpl implements ObjectiveFunction {
037
038    private final SampleLossFunction sampleLossFunction;
039    private final List<DimensionLossFunction> dimensionLossFunctions;
040    private final BatchLossFunction batchLossFunction;
041
042    /**
043     * Creates an {@code ObjectiveFunctionImpl} that computes losses at all levels:
044     * dimension, sample, and batch.
045     *
046     * <p>This constructor links together the components needed for hierarchical
047     * loss computation:</p>
048     * <ul>
049     *     <li>{@link BatchLossFunction}: computes the total loss over a batch of samples.</li>
050     *     <li>{@link SampleLossFunction}: computes the loss for a single sample by
051     *         aggregating per-dimension losses.</li>
052     *     <li>{@link DimensionLossFunction}: computes the loss for each individual
053     *         output dimension.</li>
054     * </ul>
055     *
056     * @param batchLossFunction      the loss function for the batch level
057     * @param sampleLossFunction     the loss function for the sample level
058     * @param dimensionLossFunctions the list of loss functions for each output dimension
059     */
060    public ObjectiveFunctionImpl(BatchLossFunction batchLossFunction, SampleLossFunction sampleLossFunction, List<DimensionLossFunction> dimensionLossFunctions) {
061        this.batchLossFunction = batchLossFunction;
062        this.sampleLossFunction = sampleLossFunction;
063        this.dimensionLossFunctions = dimensionLossFunctions;
064    }
065
066    /**
067     * {@inheritDoc}
068     */
069    @Override
070    public float calculateLoss(List<Pair<Float[], Float[]>> batch) {
071        List<Float> sampleLosses = new ArrayList<>(batch.size());
072        List<Float> dimensionLosses = new ArrayList<>();
073        for (Pair<Float[], Float[]> sample : batch) {
074            Float[] estimated = sample.left();
075            Float[] target = sample.right();
076            int dimensions = estimated.length;
077            for (int d = 0; d < dimensions; d++) {
078                dimensionLosses.add(getDimensionLossFunction(d).calculateDimensionLoss(estimated[d], target[d]));
079            }
080            sampleLosses.add(sampleLossFunction.calculateSampleLoss(dimensionLosses));
081            dimensionLosses.clear();
082        }
083        return batchLossFunction.calculateBatchLoss(sampleLosses);
084    }
085
086    /**
087     * {@inheritDoc}
088     */
089    @Override
090    public Float[] calculateGradient_dJ_da(int batchSize, Float[] estimated, Float[] target) {
091        int dimensions = target.length;
092        Float[] gradients = new Float[dimensions];
093        for (int d = 0; d < dimensions; d++) {
094            gradients[d] = batchLossFunction.calculateGradient_dJ_dL(batchSize)
095                    * sampleLossFunction.calculateGradient_dL_dl(dimensions)
096                    * getDimensionLossFunction(d).calculateGradient_dl_da(estimated[d], target[d]);
097        }
098        return gradients;
099    }
100
101    private DimensionLossFunction getDimensionLossFunction(int d) {
102        return dimensionLossFunctions.get(d % dimensionLossFunctions.size());
103    }
104}
